results.title: The Horse whisperer
results.creator_credit: Robert Redford, Patrick Markey and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: Robert Redford directs himself for the first time in this romantic drama adapted from the best-seller by Nicholas Evans. Teenager Grace and her friend Judith go horseback riding in upstate New York on a winter morning. After a devastating accident, Judith and her horse are killed, while Grace and her horse, Pilgrim, are seriously injured, the frightening incident leaving them both traumatised. Desperate to help, Grace’s mother puts her busy life on hold and travels west with Grace and Pilgrim to see a horse trainer with a special gift. Once there she discovers that his extraordinary gift with horses also touches the lives of those around him. Cast includes Robert Redford, Kristin Scott Thomas, Scarlett Johnasson, Sam Neill, Chris Cooper and Dianne Wiest.

results.title: The Last bus home
results.creator_credit: Johnny Gogan, Paul Donovan and Bandit Films Ltd
results.brief_description: Dublin forms the backdrop of this evocative film about friendship, punk music, secrets, sexuality, and Dublin in the late 70’s and early 80’s. Punks Reena (Annie Ryan) and Jessop (Brian O’Byrne) meet on the day the Pope comes to Dublin. They form an instant alliance both physically and musically, and together with bassist Joe (Barry Comerford) and drummer Petie (John Cronin), begin 3 years of work to gain recognition for their band; The Dead Patriots. Tensions rise personally, with repercussions professionally as one feeds off the other. The situation reaches a head when Jessop discovers a secret and makes his feelings known at the band’s final farewell gig. 10 years pass and the members re-unite for a final confrontation and re-unification. Cast also includes Anthony Brophy, Brendan Coyle and Donal O’Kelly.

results.title: A Summer's tale = Conte d'ete
results.creator_credit: Eric Rohmer, Margaret Menegoz, Canal+, Sofilmka, La Sept Cinema and Les Films du Losange
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Tales of the four seasons = Contes des quatre saisons”.
Gaspard (Melvil Poupard), a musically inclined maths graduate with time to kill is waiting for his girlfriend, Lena, in the resort town of Dinard, unbeknownst that his stable and uneventful life is about to be turned on it head when he becomes torn between his affections for three women. He whiles away the lazy afternoon hours with Margot (Amanda Langlet), a part time student and pancake house worker, and most importantly - a good listener. Margot wants a purely platonic relationship with Gaspard as she already has a boyfriend. Enter likely candidate number three, Margot’s friend Solene (Gwenaelle Simon), whom Gaspard becomes instantly smitten with and agrees to spend a weekend with on the island of Ouessant. When Lena finally arrives on the island Gaspard must finally make a choice between three women who are all offering him something different in the relationship stakes. In French with English subtitles. This film, the third in Rohmer’s “4 Season cycle” finds the director in fine story telling form.

results.title: Aguirre: wrath of God
results.creator_credit: Werner Herzog and Werner Herzog Filmproduktion
results.brief_description: A stunning and gruelling adventure about a band of Spanish conquistadors led by Aguirre, and their descent into the heart of darkness while exploring the Amazon in search of El Dorado, the legendary city of Gold. As the expedition moves further into the jungle, they leave reality behind and enter a dreamlike, otherwordly land of delusion and madness. In German with English subtitles. Cast includes Klaus Kinski, Cecilia Rivera, Ruy Guerra, Helena Rojo, Del Negro and Daniel Zacapa. In German with English subtitles.

results.title: Beyond a reasonable doubt
results.creator_credit: Fritz Lang, Bert Friedlob and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: Guilty beyond a reasonable doubt - such is the incontrovertible law which pardons the innocent and condemns the guilty. But just how fallible is the process of law? To what extent can deceit, prejudice - and the cruel powers of fate - intervene to set a murderer free, or send an innocent man to the electric chair? Dana Andrews plays Tom Carret, a writer who becomes obsessed with the idea of proving that it is possible for a completely innocent man to be found guilty of murder. And when a pretty showgirl is found strangled in a ravine, and no killer can be found, the perfect opportunity presents itself. This dark and chilling drama is the last film Lang made in Hollywood.

results.title: Lucia
results.creator_credit: Humberto Solas, Camilo Vives, Raul Canosa and Instituto Cubano del Arte e Industrias Cinematográficos (ICAIC)
results.brief_description: Acclaimed worldwide as the `Gone With the Wind of the Cuban film industry’, ‘Lucia’ is indeed Cuba’s first film spectacular, an epic, three-part feature film dramatizing three separate periods in the Cuban struggle for liberation in order to show the participation of Cuban women in that fight. In 1895, Lucia is embroiled in a tale of love and betrayal during Cuba’s war for independence from Spain; in 1933, Lucia leaves her middle-class family and becomes involved in the overthrow of the Cuban dictator Machado; and in the 1960’s, Lucia is taught how to read and write during Cuba’s literacy campaign and, as a newlywed, confronts her husband’s macho attitudes. Each episode is filmed in a distinctive visual style which translates the spirit of each historical era, with the themes of love, death and war achieving epic proportions, and providing the viewer with a good example of the role of women in history. In Spanish with English subtitles. Cast includes Raquel Revuelta, Eduardo Maure and Eslinda Nunez. (Awards: Golden Globe 1969)

results.title: Death of a bureaucrat = La Muerte de un burocrata
results.creator_credit: Tomas Gutierrez Alea, Margarita Alexandre and Instituto Cubano del Arte e Industrias Cinematográficos (ICAIC)
results.brief_description: This film is an uproarious comedy and a masterpiece of film satire. A model worker who invented a machine for manufacturing plaster busts of Cuban national hero Jose Marti, dies in an accident while working on the machine. He is buried holding his “carnet laboral” (labour card) as a symbol of his proletarian pride. The widow, upon applying for a pension, discovers that it cannot be processed without first turning in the card. In the film, the story has been elaborated to provide innumerable opportunities to parody Hollywood comedy. In Spanish with English subtitles. Cast includes Salvador Wood, Manuel Estanillo, Silvia Planas and Gaspar de Santelices.

results.title: Memories of underdevelopment = Memorias del subdesarrollo
results.creator_credit: Tomas Gutierrez Alea, Miguel Mendoza and Instituto Cubano del Arte e Industrias Cinematográficos (ICAIC)
results.brief_description: ‘Memories of Underdevelopment’ is the diary of a middle-class intellectual caught in the midst of the rapidly changing social reality of revolutionary Cuba. Sergio is a landlord and self-styled writer who decides to remain behind when his wife, family and friends, whom he ridicules, leave for Miami. But Sergio is unable to commit himself to the revolution either, and so remains only a sceptical observer. His perceptions of Cuban society, both before and after the revolution, are skillfully interwoven with documentary footage of historical events (the Bay of Pigs invasion, the Cuban Missile Crisis of 1962, and so on) to yield a complex and fascinating portrait of an individual alienated from the social process around him. Based on the novel by Esmundo Desnoes. In Spanish with English subtitles. Cast includes Sergio Corrieri, Daisy Granados, Eslinda Nunez, Omar Valdes and Rene de la Cruz.

results.title: Au Hasard Balthazar = Balthazar
results.creator_credit: Robert Bresson, Philippe Dussart, Athos Film, Parc Film and Argos Films
results.brief_description: Balthazar is a donkey which is born in a French village and whose life is spent in being a slave to his human masters. Over the donkey’s lifetime we witness the harsh realities of rural life, a life mostly hard and brutal and only occasionally made bearable by warmth or love. The humans who surround the donkey are themselves in pain but they fail to understand - or do not wish to see - the connection between themselves and the animal which they use and which they abuse. Only a young peasant girl attempts to love the animal and it is within the beauty and innocence of this relationship that something approaching religious transcendence is made possible. Robert Bresson, one of French cinema’s most important directors, spent his life working on films which explored the experiences of society’s most marginalised and vulnerable people - the unemployed, the criminal, the ill. In an ouvre remarkable for its compassion, “Au Hasard Balthazar” stands out as one of cinema’s most important humanistic visions. As we follow the cycle of birth, life, work and death as lived out by the donkey Balthazar, we experience the shock of recognition and we are aware of bearing witness to a profoundly sacred vision. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: The Towering inferno
results.creator_credit: John Guillermin, Irwin Allen, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: A skyscraper and am all-star cast go up in flames in this classic 70s disaster movie. To celebrate the construction of the Glass Tower, the world’s tallest building, architect Doug Roberts and builder James Duncan hold a gala event on the highest floors. The trouble is that Duncan’s son-in-law and electrical subcontractor, Roger Simmons, installed faulty wiring throughout the 138-story tower to save money. While the town VIPs enjoy the party, a security guard wonders why his equipment is malfunctioning, only to discover that a burnt-out circuit breaker has ignited some rubbish on the 85th floor, which is swiftly turning the skyscraper into a “towering inferno”. It is then up to Roberts and Fire Chief O’Hallorhan to find a way to stop the blaze. Cast includes Steve McQueen, Paul Newman, William Holden, Faye Dunaway, Fred Astaire, Richard Chamberlain, Jennifer Jones, O.J. Simpson, Robert Vaughn, Robert Wagner and more…

While the town VIPs enjoy the party, a security guard wonders why his equipment is malfunctioning, only to discover that a burnt-out circuit breaker has ignited some rubbish on the 85th floor, which is swiftly turning the skyscraper into a “towering inferno”. It is then up to Roberts and Fire Chief O’Hallorhan to find a way to stop the blaze. Cast includes Steve McQueen, Paul Newman, William Holden, Faye Dunaway, Fred Astaire, Richard Chamberlain, Jennifer Jones, O.J. Simpson, Robert Vaughn, Robert Wagner and more…
